Title Ingeneer

E-mail personnal clementjc.poupelin@gmail.com
Address Cité Scientifique / Building ESPRIT - desks S3.39/S3.41/S3.43 - Villeneuve d'Ascq, France
Campus Santé / Building Plateformes-Cancer - Lille, France
Campus Pasteur Lille / Building Calmette 4ème étage - Lille, France
Academic status Ingénieur d'étude
Main field of expertise Statistic
Unit // Team Plateformes Lilloises en Biologie et Santé (PLBS) - UAR CNRS 2014 - US Inserm 41 // Plateforme Bilille Bioinformatique et Biostatistique de Lille
````` ::: ::: ## Skills - Analysis and mathematical modeling of large-scale datasets (Big Data) - Time series modeling and forecasting - Implementation of Bayesian techniques and machine learning methods - Application of data science skills to microbial ecology - Use of statistical methods for meta-analyses - Research on microbiome network inference methods ## Course After earning a Scientific Baccalaureate (BAC S SVT) with a Mathematics specialization, I pursued a [Bachelor's degree in Mathematics at Nantes University](https://sciences-techniques.univ-nantes.fr/formations/licences-generales/licence-de-mathematiques), followed by a [Master's in Statistical Engineering](https://www.math.sciences.univ-nantes.fr/master-IS), which I obtained with honors (mention bien). My interest in research grew through my final-year internship, leading to my first position as a research engineer at the [UR 1404 Applied Mathematics and Computer Science from Genome to Environment (MaIAGE)](https://maiage.inrae.fr/) unit of INRAE, located in Jouy-en-Josas within the Paris-Saclay research cluster. I then joined the [Bilille platform](https://bilille.univ-lille.fr/) (Bioinformatics, biostatistics and bioanalysis) within the [UAR 2014 - US 41 PLBS](https://ums-plbs.univ-lille.fr/) unit at the University of Lille, working under an RHU-funded research program focused on neurodegenerative diseases. My primary objective is to identify biomarkers for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
